contentrichtext.text: [[File:Natalia Sedova Mexican passport.png|right|thumb|[[Mexican passport]] of Natalia Sedova from the Leon Trotsky Museum in Mexico City.]] '''Natalia Ivanovna Sedova''' ({{lang-ru|Ната́лья Ива́новна Седо́ва}}; April 5, 1882, [[Romny]] – January 23, 1962, [[Corbeil-Essonnes|Corbeil]]) is best known as the second wife of [[Leon Trotsky]], the [[Russian people|Russian]] revolutionary. She was, however, also an active revolutionary in her own right and wrote on cultural matters pertaining to [[Marxism]]. Her father was [[Ivan Sedov]], a famous explorer of the [[Arctic]].{{fact|date=April 2010}} Her life was marked by the same tragedy as that of her lover, as she accompanied him into his final exile from [[RSFSR|Russia]]. Her son, [[Lev Sedov]], was an active and leading member of the [[Bolshevik-Leninism|Bolshevik-Leninist]] movement that his father led and was almost certainly assassinated as a result of that. Her other son, [[Sergei Sedov]], who was not politically active and remained in Russia, was almost certainly murdered by agents of [[Joseph Stalin]]. After her husband's assassination in 1940, Natalia Sedova remained in [[Mexico]] and maintained contact with many exiled revolutionaries. Her best known work in these last years was a biography of Trotsky, which she co-authored with fellow Russian revolutionary [[Victor Serge]]. She was also close to the [[Spain|Spanish]] revolutionary [[Grandizo Munis]] who had led the tiny Spanish [[Sección Bolchevique-Leninista]] during the revolutionary events in the 1930s. Under his influence, she came to adopt the position that the [[Soviet Union|USSR]] was a [[state capitalism|state capitalist]] society and that the [[Fourth International]] founded by Trotsky no longer held to the revolutionary programme of Communism. Therefore, she broke from the FI in 1951.<ref>Natalia Sedova Trotsky, [http://www.marxists.org/archive/sedova-natalia/1951/05/09.htm Letter of Resignation from the Fourth International], 9 May 1951.</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.marxists.org/archive/sedova-natalia/index.htm Natalia Sedova Trotsky Archive] in the [[Marxists Internet Archive]] {{Russia-bio-stub}} {{Authority control|VIAF=2608341}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sedova, Natalia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian revolutionary | DATE OF BIRTH = April 5, 1882 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = January 23, 1962 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sedova, Natalia}} [[Category:1882 births]] [[Category:1962 deaths]] [[Category:Russian communists]] [[Category:Russian Trotskyists]] [[Category:Spouses of Russian and Soviet national leaders]] [[Category:Soviet expellees]] [[Category:Leon Trotsky]] [[Category:Naturalized citizens of Mexico]] [[Category:Mexican people of Russian descent]] [[Category:Soviet dissidents]]
